bug.author: jiyer2016
bug.summary: YataiService Web UI not responding on Docker
bug.description:
Describe the bug I started up the YataiService on Docker (RHEL Base Image) <denchmark-code>bentoml yatai-service-start --debug --verbose
[2020-08-27 07:40:38,709] DEBUG - Enabling gRPC server reflection for debugging * Starting BentoML YataiService gRPC Server * Debug mode: on * Web UI: running on http://127.0.0.1:3000 * Running on 127.0.0.1:50051 (Press CTRL+C to quit) * Usage: * Set config: `bentoml config set yatai_service.url=127.0.0.1:50051` * Set env var: `export BENTOML__YATAI_SERVICE__URL=127.0.0.1:50051` * Help and instructions: https://docs.bentoml.org/en/latest/guides/yatai_service.html * Web server log can be found here: /home/<some_user>/bentoml/logs/yatai_web_server.log </denchmark-code>
I have the local port 3000 on docker exposed to the outside world. I proceed with accessing the Web UI URL from a browser - that does NOT work (not acccessible) I then ssh into my docker container and use curl to access the Web UI URL - that doesn't work either. <denchmark-code>curl http://127.0.0.1:3000 curl: (7) Failed connect to 127.0.0.1:3000; Connection refused </denchmark-code>
I look at the logs directory - surprisingly it is missing the yatai_web_server.log I would have expected a zero byte log file for yatai_web_server.log - as was the case on my local environment. <denchmark-code>ls -l ~/bentoml/logs -rw-r--r--. 1 <some_user> <some_group> 258 Aug 27 07:40 active.log -rw-r--r--. 1 <some_user> <some_group> 0 Aug 27 07:40 feedback.log -rw-r--r--. 1 <some_user> <some_group> 0 Aug 27 07:40 prediction.log
</denchmark-code>
I need inputs on what else I should be looking at to debug the problem. I don't see any errors in a log file. Environment:
Python 3.8.0 bentoml, version 0.8.4 node v8.12.0 npm 6.4.1 Docker - RHEL Base Image (I use my own Docker file - and NOT the ones autogenerated by bentoml)

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiyer2016>@jiyer2016</denchmark-link> did you use the officially released docker image for YataiService from the docker hub? <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/bentoml/yatai-service>https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/bentoml/yatai-service</denchmark-link> Or did you try building the docker image yourself?

If you are building your own docker image for YataiService, and installing bentoml from source code, you will need to build the javascript/typescript project before packaging them into a bentoml distribution. Take a look at our release script here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/blob/master/dev/release_pypi.sh>https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/blob/master/dev/release_pypi.sh</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/parano>@parano</denchmark-link> - I am not building the Docker image from source. So I assume, I do not need to build the javascript / typescript project. Here is how my custom Dockerfile for yatai-service looks: <denchmark-code>FROM <company provided base image containing Python 3.8> RUN pip3.8 install bentoml==0.8.4 grpcio-reflection==1.27.2 RUN yum -y install nodejs npm </denchmark-code>
And then I start it up using the command: bentoml yatai-service-start --no-ui --debug --verbose I also have a configuration that exposes local ports 3000 and 50051 to outside the world.
I see, â€”no-ui might be the reason then, it means running only the gRPC server without the web ui server.

Sorry, I meant I use: bentoml yatai-service-start --debug --verbose I had temporarily added the --no-ui flag to turn OFF the Web UI since it wasn't working for me. I can confirm that this is still an issue for me.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiyer2016>@jiyer2016</denchmark-link> could you try into the container where you ran , and try running the following command to see what's the output? Find the installed bentoml module path: import bentoml print(bentoml.__path__) cd to the path printed from the command above, and run the following command: node yatai/web/dist/bundle.js localhost:50051 3000 ~/bentoml/logs/yatai_web_server.log

Thanks, that was helpful - Here is the error I get: <denchmark-code>node yatai/web/dist/bundle.js localhost:50051 3000 ~/bentoml/logs/yatai_web_server.log Error: @grpc/grpc-js only works on Node ^8.13.0 || >=10.10.0 at Object.module.exports.e.exports (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/bentoml/yatai/web/dist/bundle.js:38:13139) </denchmark-code>
I am currently running a lower version of node - Let me upgrade and see if that helps. <denchmark-code>$ node --version v8.12.0 $ npm --version 6.4.1
</denchmark-code>
In the meanwhile do you recommend any specific version for node and npm ?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiyer2016>@jiyer2016</denchmark-link> The latest LTS node version and npm version is a good version to use. If you want to build the Yatai Web UI yourself, please use node version 12.13.0. The 12.18.3 node version breaks the UI bundler parcel.
